poem:
"Lobbying Labyrinth"

Labour hawks, in shadow's allure,
In a web of power shift n' lure.
Cunning Craig, both fox and hen,
Juggles with his sly quill pen.
On the public stage he vows and pledges,
Yet in secrecy, he hedges.
A dance between what's fair, what sells,
In his lobbying fortress dwell.
Conundrum deep, truth's elusive stance,
In this endless political dance.
